intro: Leontice thalictrifolium, commonly known as false mares tail, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a low-growing habit with creeping stems that produce numerous small, inconspicuous flowers. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
